case_title: SURYABALI and others vs THE VITH ADDITIONAL DISTRICT JUDGE, DEORIA and others
case_number: Civil Miscellaneous Writ Petition No. 9631 of 1988
respondent: THE VITH ADDITIONAL DISTRICT JUDGE, DEORIA and others

legal_provisions.constitution_article: Art. 226 of the Constitution of India
legal_provisions.procedural_code: Order 17, Rules 1, 2, and 3 of the Code of Civil Procedure (C.P.C.)

judgment_summary.issue: Refusal to grant adjournment to the defendant for producing evidence.
court_findings: Procedural fairness and principles of natural justice were violated.
Defendant was not granted reasonable time to produce evidence.
Interpretation of procedural rules must advance substantial justice.
court_directions: Parties directed to appear before the Munsif on 1988-12-21.
Short adjournments to be granted for objections and evidence production.
Suit to be disposed of by 1989-03-31.

references: Union of India v. Tulsi Ram Patel, AIR 1985 SC 1416
Maharashtra State Board of S.H.S.E. v. Paritosh Bhupesh Kumar Seth, AIR 1984 SC 1543
Liberty Oil Mills v. Union of India, (1984) 3 SCC 465
Nirankar Nath Wahi v. Vth Addl. Distt. Judge, AIR 1984 SC 1268
